action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: rabbit, pin, drop, key, dwarf, fair, cliff, cat, screen.
Your opponent's team words are: king, star, conductor, gas, day, yard, opera, piano.
Distractor words are: well, china, jet, state, spike, sock, slug.
The kill words are: tower.
action.label: context

action.content:
<think>
Okay, let's see. I need to come up with a single-word clue that relates to some of my team's words: rabbit, pin, drop, key, dwarf, fair, cliff, cat, screen. The opponent's words are king, star, conductor, gas, day, yard, opera, piano. Distractors are well, china, jet, state, spike, sock, slug. And the kill word is tower.

First, I should figure out which of my team's words can be connected by a common theme. Let me list them again: rabbit, pin, drop, key, dwarf, fair, cliff, cat, screen. Hmm. Maybe some of these can be linked through different categories. For example, "cliff" and "drop" could relate to a "drop" as in a waterfall or a sudden fall. "Rabbit" and "cat" are animals. "Pin" and "key" are objects. "Dwarf" and "fair" might be part of "dwarf fair" or something else. "Screen" could be part of a movie screen.

Wait, but the clue needs to be a single word that's semantically related to some of the target words. Let me think of possible clues. Let's see:

- "Fall" could relate to "drop" and "cliff" (as in a cliff fall) and maybe "rabbit" (like a rabbit fall? Not sure). But
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
